Key Match Events: Brennan Johnson scored the fastest hat-trick in Iceland vs Wales match history with his seventh goal in seven games.
Logi Tomasson came off the bench to score and spark Iceland’s comeback, scoring two goals in three minutes.
Post-Match Reflections: Craig Bellamy praised the performance despite the loss, stating it was a learning experience for both teams.
Bellamy admitted he learned about the players and they learned about him, indicating growth for the team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Danny Ward’s own goal led to Iceland’s equalizer.
Johnson was booked for a petulant altercation with Jon Dagur Thorsteinsson and will miss the next match.
